You were honest, wry and wonderful. You brought to life a character that shaped so much of who I am. I'm grateful and heartbroken.

He's a sucker for this girl. #EverydayEliza https://t.co/JJDHk4IaZ4
@Hortmum I'm getting lots of sunlight out on walks with E. I think I needed to alter how I was consuming news. Seems to be helping.
@satefan @beltzner I'm working on something similar for FB. I never used to filter in order to stay current on trends for work.
@beltzner 3) I was witty AF on my break and it was kind of lost on the baby.
@beltzner 2) I have control over what I see. So now I'm following 99% friends in the hope that SM is more conversational and less clickbait.
@beltzner I realized three things during my break: 1) withdrawing is not going to fix all the negativity. Be the change you want to see, etc
I may come and go, but I wanted to share that sometimes it's good to take a break and take care of you.
While away I read the news, texted with friends, saw many IRL and felt better. I missed a lot of my faraway friends, but had to take a break
Which felt strange because I've been all in on it for so long.
I'd noticed that I was becoming a bit depressed and social media was making me feel worse.
I've taken two weeks off Facebook and Twitter (stayed on Instagram to keep Fe and E pics in supply) and have been happier for it.
